SENT.plain: We describe a patient with soft-tissue and bony hypertrophy of all four limbs
The upper limbs were erythematous, with associated finger deformity
The soft-tissue irregular hypertrophy and engorgement subsided when the limbs were elevated
Retinal examination showed large, dilated, tortuous veins, with no dye leakage on fluorescein angiography
We feel that this case represents an unusual variant of the Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome
